result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond J. LaPuma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond J. LaPuma is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond J. LaPuma was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:02 p.m. Defendant Raymond J. LaPuma in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin  along with DA intern, Eric Klemm, under the student practice rule. Calling 16cf37 and 16cf28. Schiek/Bennett statement to resolution. State moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor violation of bail jumping in 16cf37 - Granted. State moves to dismiss Count 2 in 16cf28 - Granted. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant enters no contest plea to both counts.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Victim Impact Statement filed. Schiek/Bennett/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
WHS/POP - 6 months CC
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
AODA Assessment and follow-through
Domestic Abuse/Batterer's Group/Anger Management counseling as deemed appropriate by PO
Any other counseling/conditions deemed appropriate by PO.
Appeal rights given. Payment application plan given.
Adj. 2:23 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery  - includes cover letter

3:38 p.m. Defendant Raymond J. LaPuma in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf28 and 16cf37. Schiek statement that State would not be able to establish probable cause in 16cf28 - Requests that Court not find probable cause, proceed to PTC. State moves to amend 16cf28 to violation of 961.573(1) - A Misdemeanor and in 16cf37 to amend to misdemeanor bail jumping - Granted. Bennett enters not guilty pleas. Bail continued. Adj. 3:42 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
No abusive contact with Karen Bock.

2:59 p.m. Defendant Raymond J. LaPuma in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cf28 and 16cf37.  In receipt of both complaints, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing - Time limits waived. Bennett motion to modify bond. Schiek statement to motion. Court modifies bond to provide that there be no abusive contact with Karen Bock. 
Bail continued. Adj. 3:03 p.m.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 03:15 pm.
No contact WHATSOEVER with victim Karen Bock. No intoxicants; no taverns.

1:19 pm Defendant Raymond J. LaPuma in court, via video, in custody.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond. Adj. 1:23 p.m.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
